# Data-Analysis-Dashboard-Excel
## Project Objective
**This project is an Excel-based Customer Analytics Dashboard designed to analyze customer-wise sales performance using data from two sources: Customer Information and Order Details. The dashboard provides interactive KPIs, summary insights, and customer-level trends to support business decision-making.**

## Dataset used
[Dataset](https://github.com/rameshanakapalli/Data-analysis-Dashboard-Excel-/blob/main/Data-Analysis-Dashboard.xlsm)

## Questions (KPIs)

**What is the total revenue generated by each customer?**

**How many orders do they place, and how frequently?**

**What is their average order value and freight cost?**

**When did they last place an order?**

**Which shipper do they use the most?**

**How has the customer’s revenue trended over the years?**

**Are their orders increasing, stable, or declining?**

**Which periods show high or low sales activity?**

## Dashboard
<img width="1913" height="1101" alt="Screenshot 2025-12-05 133350" src="https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a54d80c8-c1d4-4543-87a2-bcbf24c759ce" />

## Project Insights

### **Customer Insights**
**• High-revenue customers stand out clearly, while some show inconsistent purchasing patterns.**  
**• Year-wise trends reveal which customers are growing, stable, or declining.**

### **Order Behavior**
**• Frequent buyers tend to have higher average order values.**  
**• Recent activity highlights active vs dormant customers.**

### **Shipping & Operations**
**• Certain shippers are preferred more often, indicating reliability.**  
**• Freight cost variations suggest areas for optimization.**

### **Customer Segmentation**
**• High-Value, Mid-Value, Low-Value, and At-Risk customer groups improve decision-making.**

## Final Conclusion

**This project converts raw customer and order data into meaningful insights using clear Excel KPIs. It highlights customer value, purchasing patterns, and operational gaps. Overall, the dashboard supports smarter, data-driven decision-making.**
